author: Canadian Soil Information Service
name: Canada's Boreal and Subarctic Peatlands
comments: Most Canadian peatlands occur in the Boreal Peatland Region (64%) and Subarctic Peatland Region (33%). 59% of all stored carbon in Canada is contained in these peatlands.

author: Lehner & Grill (2013)
name: HydroBASINS
comments: HydroBASINS is a series of polygon layers that depict watershed boundaries and sub-basin delineations at a global scale.

author: Lehner & Grill (2013)
name: HydroRIVERS
comments: HydroRivers is a database aiming to provide the vectorized line network of all global rivers that have a catchment area of at least 10 km2 or an average river flow of 0.1 cubic meters per second, or both.

author: Messager et al. (2016)
name: HydroLAKES
comments: HydroLAKES is a database aiming to provide the shoreline polygons of all global lakes with a surface area of at least 10 ha.

author: Linke et al. (2019)
name: HydroATLAS
comments: HydroATLAS offers a global compendium of hydro-environmental sub-basin and river reach characteristics at 15 arc-second resolution.

author: Hermosilla et al. (2016)
name: Wildfire Year/dNBR/Mask 1985-2015
comments: Wildfire change magnitude 85-15. Spectral change magnitude for wildfires that occurred from 1985 and 2015.

author: Government of Canada
name: Canadian Protected and Conserved Areas Database (CPCAD)
comments: Protected areas are as of December 2020. The data set aslso includes delisted areas.

name: Three decades of forest structural dynamics over Canada's forested ecosystems using Landsat time-series and lidar plots
comments: Wall-to-wall estimates of forest structure, 10 different metrics estimated (e.g. average height of trees). Not available to the public yet. Mastasci et al. 2017. Only 2015 is available

author: WWF
name: GLWD-level1
comments: Level 1 (GLWD-1) comprises the 3067 largest lakes (area = 50 km2) and 654 largest reservoirs (storage capacity = 0.5 km3) worldwide, and includes extensive attribute data

author: WWF
name: GLWD-level2
comments: Level 2 (GLWD-2) comprises permanent open water bodies with a surface area = 0.1 km2 excluding the water bodies contained in GLWD-1. The approximately 250,000 polygons of GLWD-2 are attributed as lakes, reservoirs and rivers.

author: WWF
name: GLWD-level3
comments: Level 3 (GLWD-3) comprises lakes, reservoirs, rivers and different wetland types in the form of a global raster map at 30-second resolution

author: Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry
name: Ontario Watershed Boundaries (OWB) - Main
comments: The Ontario Watershed Boundaries (OWB) collection represents the authoritative watershed boundaries for Ontario. Main contains all watershed levels from primary to quaternary, and level 5 and 6 watersheds for select areas of the province.

author: Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry
name: Ontario Watershed Boundaries (OWB) - Primary
comments: The Ontario Watershed Boundaries Primary (OWBPRIM) collection represents the authoritative watershed boundaries for Ontario. Primary contains all primary watersheds or major drainage areas (WSCMDA) in the Canadian classification.

author: Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry
name: Ontario Watershed Boundaries (OWB) - Secondary
comments: The Ontario Watershed Boundaries Secondary(OWBSEC) collection represents the authoritative watershed boundaries for Ontario. Contains all all secondary watersheds or sub drainage areas (WSCSDA).

author: Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry
name: Ontario Watershed Boundaries (OWB) - Tertiary
comments: The Ontario Watershed Boundaries Terciary (OWBTER) collection represents the authoritative watershed boundaries for Ontario. Contains all tertiary watersheds or sub-sub drainage areas (WSCSSDA).

author: Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry
name: Ontario Watershed Boundaries (OWB) - Quaternary
comments: The Ontario Watershed Boundaries Quaternary (OWBQUAT) collection represents the authoritative watershed boundaries for Ontario. Contains all quaternary watersheds or 6-digit drainage areas (WSC6).

author: Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry
name: UTM (Universal Transverse Mercator) 10 Km Grid
comments: The Ontario Government also produces other UTM grids at varying resolutions.

author: Martin et al. 2018
name: Global patterns in wood carbon concentration across the world’s trees and forests
comments: A data request is needed to downlaod the data. A new wood carbon database will be available in 2022.

author: Guindon et al. 2017
name: Canada Landsat Disturbance (CanLaD) 2017
comments: Areas affected by fire or by harvest from 1984 to 2015 are identified at the level of individual 30m pixels on the Landsat grid.  There are two rasters in the folder.

author: Government of Ontario
name: Forest Insect Damage Event
comments: Shows areas where forest insect pests have damaged or killed trees by defoliation, foliage mining and wood boring. About 100K polygons.

author: Hermosilla et al. 2022
name: High-resolution annual forest land cover maps for Canada’s forested ecosystems (1984-2019).
comments: Forest land cover time series, 1984-2019

author: Land Information Ontario
name: Fire disturbance area
comments: Data on the locations of forest fires in Ontario.
